meanings.definition: To give a new title or name to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reh her favorite teddy bear 'Fluffy' to 'Mr. Cuddles'.
meanings.sent2: The author chose to reh his book from 'The Adventure of a Lifetime' to 'The Journey of a Hero'.
meanings.sent3: After much thought, she finally decided to reh her cat 'Whiskers' to 'Shadow', much to the cat's confusion.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar reh itself into a beautiful butterfly, transforming its identity completely.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand had the power to reh objects into something entirely different with a flick.

meanings.definition: To make a sound expressing hesitation or doubt.
meanings.sent1: He would often reh before answering a difficult question in class.
meanings.sent2: The child started to reh when asked if he had finished his homework.
meanings.sent3: The puppy let out a little reh before deciding to jump into the puddle.
meanings.sent4: The old door rehed as it opened, as if unsure of its ability to still function.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves reh softly, creating a soothing melody in the garden.
